TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SortVersion extends System.Object implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Globalization.SortVersion>
Public NotInheritable Class SortVersion Implements IEquatable(Of SortVersion)

summary.span: 提供用于比较和排序字符串的 Unicode 版本的相关信息。

span.span: Provides information about the version of Unicode used to compare and order strings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ### .NET Framework 中的排序和字符串比较Sorting and string comparison in the .NET Framework 从[!INCLUDE[net_v20sp1_long](~/includes/net-v20sp1-long-md.md)]通过[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]、 每个版本的.net Framework 具有包含包含排序权重的表和数据在字符串标准化的基于 Unicode 的特定版本。From the [!INCLUDE[net_v20sp1_long](~/includes/net-v20sp1-long-md.md)] through the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], each version of the.NET Framework has included tables that contain sort weights and data on string normalization and that are based on a particular version of Unicode. 在[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]，这些表是否存在取决于操作系统：In the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], the presence of these tables depends on the operating system: - 在[!INCLUDE[win7](~/includes/win7-md.md)]和以前版本的 Windows 操作系统，表将继续用于比较和排序字符串。On [!INCLUDE[win7](~/includes/win7-md.md)] and previous versions of the Windows operating system, the tables continue to be used for comparing and ordering strings. - 在[!INCLUDE[win8](~/includes/win8-md.md)]，.NET Framework 委托的字符串比较和排序操作对操作系统。On [!INCLUDE[win8](~/includes/win8-md.md)], the .NET Framework delegates string comparison and ordering operations to the operating system. 因此，字符串比较的结果可以依赖.NET Framework 版本中，不仅在操作系统版本上，如下表所示。Consequently, the result of a string comparison can depend not only on the .NET Framework version, but also on the operating system version, as the following table shows. 请注意，受支持的 Unicode 版本的列表仅适用于字符比较和排序；不适用于 Unicode 字符串按类别分类。Note that this list of supported Unicode versions applies to character comparison and sorting only; it does not apply to classification of Unicode characters by category. |.NET Framework 版本.NET Framework version|操作系统Operating system|Unicode 版本Unicode version| |----------------------------|----------------------|---------------------| |[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]|所有操作系统All operating systems|Unicode 5.0Unicode 5.0| |[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] 和更高版本的.NET Framework and later versions of the .NET Framework|[!INCLUDE[win7](~/includes/win7-md.md)]|Unicode 5.0Unicode 5.0| |[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] 和更高版本的.NET Framework and later versions of the .NET Framework|[!INCLUDE[win8](~/includes/win8-md.md)] 和更高版本的 Windows 操作系统版本 and later Windows operating system versions|Unicode 6.0Unicode 6.0| 在[!INCLUDE[win8](~/includes/win8-md.md)]，这是因为的 Unicode 版本的字符串比较中使用和排序取决于操作系统的版本，即使对于.NET Framework 的特定版本运行的应用程序可能不同的字符串比较的结果。On [!INCLUDE[win8](~/includes/win8-md.md)], because the version of Unicode used in string comparison and ordering depends on the version of the operating system, the results of string comparison may differ even for applications that run on a specific version of the .NET Framework. ### 在.NET Core 中的排序和字符串比较Sorting and string comparison in .NET Core 执行字符串比较时，所有版本的.NET Core 都依赖于基础操作系统。All versions of .NET Core rely on the underlying operating system when performing string comparisons. 因此，字符串比较或字符串的排序顺序的顺序的结果取决于执行比较时使用的操作系统的 Unicode 版本。Therefore, the results of a string comparison or the order in which strings are sorted depends on the version of Unicode used by the operating system when performing the comparison. 在 Linux 和 macOS 上[International Components for Unicode](http://site.icu-project.org/)库提供用于比较和排序 Api 实现。On Linux and macOS, [International Components for Unicode](http://site.icu-project.org/) libraries provide the implementation for comparison and sorting APIs. ### 使用 SortVersion 类Using the SortVersion class 类提供了有关使用.NET 进行字符串比较和排序的 Unicode 版本的信息。The class provides information about the Unicode version used by .NET for string comparison and ordering. 它使开发人员编写应用程序，可以检测并已成功处理的用于比较和排序的应用程序的字符串的 Unicode 版本中的更改。It enables developers to write applications that can detect and successfully handle changes in the version of Unicode that is used to compare and sort an application's strings. 可以实例化两种方式的对象：You can instantiate a object in two ways: - 通过调用构造函数中，它会实例化一个新对象基于版本编号和排序 id。By calling the constructor, which instantiates a new object based on a version number and sort ID. 重新创建时，此构造函数是最有用中保存的数据对象。This constructor is most useful when recreating a object from saved data. - 通过检索的值属性。By retrieving the value of the property. 此属性提供有关使用应用程序正在其运行的.NET 实现的 Unicode 版本的信息。This property provides information about the Unicode version used by the .NET implementation on which the application is running. 类具有两个属性和，这表示 Unicode 版本和用于字符串比较的特定区域性。The class has two properties, and , that indicate the Unicode version and the specific culture used for string comparison. 属性是一个任意的数字值，反映了用于字符串比较的 Unicode 版本和属性是一个任意反映其约定用于字符串比较的区域性。The property is an arbitrary numeric value that reflects the Unicode version used for string comparison, and the property is an arbitrary that reflects the culture whose conventions are used for string comparison. 仅当比较两个时，这两个属性的值很重要通过使用对象方法，运算符，或运算符。The values of these two properties are important only when you compare two objects by using the method, the operator, or the operator. 通常使用对象时保存或检索某种形式的区分区域性的排序字符串数据，如索引或文本字符串本身。You typically use a object when saving or retrieving some form of culture-sensitive, ordered string data, such as indexes or the literal strings themselves. 这需要执行以下步骤：This requires the following steps: 1. 保存的有序的字符串数据时，和还会保存属性值。When the ordered string data is saved, the and property values are also saved. 2. 当检索有序的字符串数据时，你可以重新创建对象用于通过调用排序字符串构造函数。When the ordered string data is retrieved, you can recreate the object used for ordering the strings by calling the constructor. 3. 此新实例化对象进行比较反映其约定使用字符串数据进行排序的区域性的对象。This newly instantiated object is compared with a object that reflects the culture whose conventions are used to order the string data. 4. 如果两个对象是否不相等，必须重新排序的字符串数据。If the two objects are not equal, the string data must be reordered. 说明如示例所示。The example provides an illustration. ## Examples 下面的示例包含一部分中使用的应用程序的源代码类，以确保的固有名称对象进行正确排序的当前系统和当前区域性。The following example contains a portion of the source code from an application that uses the class to ensure that the native names of objects are ordered appropriately for the current system and current culture. 它使用并对象来存储和检索排序将数据从数据文件，名为`Regions.dat`而不是检索和每次运行该应用程序时对数据进行排序。It uses the and objects to store and retrieve ordered data from a data file named `Regions.dat` rather than retrieving and ordering data each time the application is run. 该示例首先检查以确定是否存在数据文件。The example first checks to determine whether the data file exists. 如果不是，它将创建数据和设置`reindex`标志以指示数据必须可重新排列和重新保存。If it does not, it creates the data and sets the `reindex` flag, which indicates that the data must be resorted and saved again. 否则为它检索数据，并比较了已保存对象与当前系统上的当前区域性的对象。Otherwise, it retrieves the data and compares the saved object with the object for the current culture on the current system. 如果它们不相等，或者`reindex`以前已设置标志，它会采用数据。If they are not equal, or if the `reindex` flag had been set previously, it resorts the data. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.SortVersion#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.sortversion/cs/example1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.SortVersion#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.sortversion/vb/example1.vb#1)]

span.span: A version number.
A sort ID.
Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数实例化对象使用指定的版本和排序 id。This constructor instantiates a object with the specified version and sort ID. `fullVersion`自变量分配给属性。The `fullVersion` argument is assigned to the property. `sortId`自变量分配给属性。The `sortId` argument is assigned to the property. 此构造函数可用于重新创建对象从已序列化或保存的数据。This constructor is useful for recreating a object from data that has been serialized or saved. 此版本然后可以与当前的应用程序版本，以确定是否可用于显示和排序应用程序的字符串的 Unicode 版本的比较。This version can then be compared with the current application version to determine whether the version of Unicode used to display and order the application's strings is available.
